docs.snippet: The United States steamer Huntsville, CICERO PRICE, commander, from the Gulf Blockading Squadron and Key West, 24th inst., arrived yesterday.

headline.main: NEWS FROM KEY WEST.; Movements of the United States Vessels Reports of Operations Against New-Orleans Health of the Troops, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States steamer Huntsville, CICERO PRICE, commander, from the Gulf Blockading Squadron and Key West, 24th inst., arrived yesterday.

docs.snippet: The first detailed official report of the battle of Winchester is published this morning. It is written by Capt. SHRIBER, of Gen. SHIELDS' Staff, and gives a minute account of what has proved to be  one of the most important battles of the war thus...
docs.lead_paragraph: The first detailed official report of the battle of Winchester is published this morning. It is written by Capt. SHRIBER, of Gen. SHIELDS' Staff, and gives a minute account of what has proved to be one of the most important battles of the war thus far. We also give an account written by Gen. SHIELDS himself to a friend.

docs.snippet: The steamship New-York, from Southampton 10th March, arrived here last night, with three days later news from Europe.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE NEW-YORK Debate in the British Parliament on International Maritime Laws.THE ARREST OF REBELS IN MORROCCOStatement of Mr. Layard in theHouse of Commons.FINANCIAL AND COMMERCIAL NEWS.

docs.abstract: British Commons debates international maritime law
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship New-York, from Southampton 10th March, arrived here last night, with three days later news from Europe.

headline.main: FROM PORT ROYAL.; Arrival of the Transport Empire City.

docs.snippet: The House, last evening, was engaged as telegraphed, upon the assessment bill. The only point settled in the long discussion was the allowance of offsets on indebtedness.

headline.main: NEWS FROM ALBANY.; Consideration of the Assessment Bill in the Assembly Accumulation of Bills for Third Reading Further Debate on the Health Bill, &c. Report of Assembly Committee on Street Openings, &c., in the City of New-York, consisting of Messrs. Birdsall, Camp, Hardy, Shaw and Varian.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House, last evening, was engaged as telegraphed, upon the assessment bill. The only point settled in the long discussion was the allowance of offsets on indebtedness.

docs.snippet: The far-famed Parson BROWNLOW, as you are aware, has safely arrived in this city. His arrival has sent a thrill of delight through every loyal heart here, and, I am sure, will be hailed with equal gratification in every part of the North. Everything...
docs.lead_paragraph: The far-famed Parson BROWNLOW, as you are aware, has safely arrived in this city. His arrival has sent a thrill of delight through every loyal heart here, and, I am sure, will be hailed with equal gratification in every part of the North. Everything conected with the Parson's history during the last six months being of deep interest to all that sympathize with the Union. I have obtained the following full...

headline.main: NEWS FROM THE SOUTH.; Movements of our Army as Learned from the Rebels. Operations on the Tennessee and Mississippi. YANCEY'S SPEECH AT NEW-ORLEANS. Another Proclamation by Gen. Sherman. Very Interesting from Florida---The Union Element There. MOVEMENTS OF THE NATIONAL ARMY, GATHERED FROM REBEL NEWSPAPERS. MOVEMENTS ON THE TENNESSEE. The Memphis Appeal, of the 19th inst., says:

docs.lead_paragraph: The Memphis Appeal, of the 19th inst., says; "Our latest intelligence of the movements of the enemy is that a large force has been landed on the west bank of the Tennessee, at Chalk Bluffs, twenty- six miles from Corinth. At this point, it is said, they have thrown up defences of considerable strength and extent. They have also commenced the construction...

docs.snippet: Iu the Senate, Saturday, a favorable report was made on the bill to amend the law relative to taking the testimony of witnesses out of the State; also on the bill to authorize clerks of Boards of Excise to take affidavits in certain cases. A bill to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Iu the Senate, Saturday, a favorable report was made on the bill to amend the law relative to taking the testimony of witnesses out of the State; also on the bill to authorize clerks of Boards of Excise to take affidavits in certain cases. headline.main: MISCELLANEOUS REBELLION NEWS.; FROM SHIP ISLAND. THE REBELS IN HAVANA. COTTON VESSELS CAPTURED.
